Text.Value: Make a habit of just letting yourself into people's homes, do you?
It's a bold thief who would just stroll into the druid Jaheira's home. Still time to turn around and go.
I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. Your mother hasn't mentioned me in any letters?
Who's your mother?
Minsc? I don't understand - she was chasing down the cult for a lead to save you. If she's already done it...
A friend. Though maybe not so close as I'd hoped - she never mentioned you.
She's... she's alive? Who are you to her - a Harper?
I told you, my mother isn't here.
Bring her here. So we can kill her.
Wait - I know Jaheira. I've just returned to the city with her.
Ah... Rion? Minsc does not like to correct you, but... I think you are mistaken. Jaheira is not dead!
Bring Jaheira home. We are in dire need of a mother-daughter chat.
I take it you won't be coming back to us until all of this is done. So hurry up.
Allies. We fought General Ketheric Thorm together.
My mother's not here, if that's who you've come to see.
Leave.
Just a short time ago, she pretended to be angry at Boo for rolling around in her herb-pouch.
Boo would be proud, to join such a warrior in battle!
There was talk of your hammer. And... Minsc's head as the anvil.
She's dead. The great Jaheira finally her match, taking down General Ketheric Thorm out in the shadowlands.
Eh, Rion...? We know your mother is not here. She is travelling with us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Speaking up as Rion hasn't seen him yet - a little sheepish to correct her

Text.Value: I hear you've been causing mother some trouble. Remember what I told you about causing mother trouble?
Good boy. Just remember, Fig has always wanted a hamster.
...So you're not here to see her? Who are you, then?
General...? We'd heard of the cult army heading this way - I assumed she'd died trying to stop it.
Minsc. I... wasn't expecting to see you. If you're looking for mother, I... well. There's no easy way to say it:
But... she's alive. EVERYONE, SHE'S ALIVE!
Ah, well. If Boo were to be technical, he would say that it is not Jaheira alone who saved Minsc. It was this one here.

EditorData.NodeContext: Still a little sheepish, no direct gesture to player

Text.Value: But Minsc would be dead. You are heard and understood, Rion.
Don't be too wounded. Up until this moment, she was missing - presumed dead out in the shadowlands.
Thank you for looking out for her. Now bring her back alive - she's too old for any heroic-death nonsense.

Synopsis: Conversation with Jaheira's Daughter if your party doesn't have Jaheira with you/after Jaheira has spoken to her. Her children should combo to give the player just enough information to hang themselves with Re: why Jaheira's children are of vastly different ages (and in theory races)
